snippet: If a girl under 16 gives birth and will not identify the father, a new Mississippi law says the authorities must collect umbilical cord blood and run DNA tests to prove paternity.
abstract: New Mississippi law states that if a girl under 16 gives birth and will not identify the father, authorities must collect umbilical cord blood and run DNA tests to prove paternity as step toward prosecuting statutory rape cases.
lead_paragraph: If a girl under 16 gives birth and will not identify the father, a new Mississippi law says the authorities must collect umbilical cord blood and run DNA tests to prove paternity.

headline.main: Mississippi: Test on Umbilical Cords to Find Paternity
headline.print_headline: Mississippi: Test On Umbilical Cords To Find Paternity
